Don't see any real option to debug...

data.title: [i18n] Fix Korean Translation
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP1 x64

There is a translation error in `i18n/kor/src/vs/workbench/browser/actions/configureLocale.i18n.json`

```
"doc": "지원되는 언어 목록은 {0}을(를) 참조하세요."
```

this text should be

```
"doc": "지원되는 언어 목록은 {0} 을(를) 참조하세요."
```

`{0}` is replaced with url `https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=761051`.
then, the hyperlink in original text is interpreted as `https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=761051을(를)`.
so when you click the link, you only can see the wrong page.

data.title: Test: launch.json usability improvements
data.body:
- [x] Win 10 @weinand 
- [x] any os @mousetraps

We have invested in making 'launch.json' more user friendly, more details #13353
Have a node project wihtout a 'launch.json', verify:
- A new 'launch.json' gets generated once you want to start debugging
- The content of this 'launch.json' makes sense (ordering is intutitive) and is as thin as possible 
- You get inteli-sense if you want to add aditional configurations
- "sourceMaps" and "outFiles" configurations are added if you have opened a typescript or a coffeescript file
- There is a top level link to documentation and documentation makes sense (suggestions about documentation please file to @gregvanl in vscode-docs repo)
- Not useful attributes are grayed out so it is easier for the user to spot which attributes need to be edited

data.title: Some questions about "user settings"  and "emmet" & "snippet"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: windows 10 x64

> I am a Chinese, My English is not very good, these words are written using translation software, Excuse me.
> 
> I like VScode very much，I used it from V0.9 onwards, from the first day I know it, together with a strong recommendation to a friend, although there are still some problems, but I believe it will be getting better and better!

There are a few problems have always wanted to say, but my English is not good, today I have the courage to say it, hoping to improve.
1. user settings：

When we set some options, except the "true" or  "false" option, there is no hint at the value of the comment line, like:

``` json
    // 控制编辑器是否应呈现空白字符
    "editor.renderWhitespace": "none",
    // 控制是否将代码段与其他建议一起显示以及它们的排序方式。
    "editor.snippetSuggestions": "bottom",

--------------------I wish it could be like the following------------
    // 控制编辑器是否应呈现空白字符, valid values: ["none","boundary","all"]
    "editor.renderWhitespace": "none",
    // 控制是否将代码段与其他建议一起显示以及它们的排序方式。valid values: ["top","bottom","inline","none"]
    "editor.snippetSuggestions": "bottom",

This will be very convenient for us to set up
```
1.  "emmet" & "snippet" 

In VS code, when we enter the PHP built-in function, like **"echo"**, when we enter "echo", It will appear smart tips, but when we press the `tab` button, it just shows `echo` .

In Sublime Text, when we enter `echo` and press the `tab`, it is `'echo "string";'` , and the cursor on the `string`, it greatly saving times.

``` php
// enter `echo` and press tab:
------------In VS code------------
echo

------------In sublime text------------
echo "string";
```

data.title: Issue with file extension when saving XML files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.0 (e52fb0bc87e6f5c8f144e172639891d8d8c9aa55, 2016-10-10T18:37:40.189Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: DotJoshJohnson.xml-1.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new file
2. Change the language to XML
3. Save the file as, with a type of XML
4. Navigate to the file in explorer
5. The extension of the file is actually ASCX and not XML

If you open an existing file with the XML extension and save the file then there is no issue, this only seems to be a problem with new files.

data.title: JS: Can't search function symbol when set as property of an object
Typing lag when using tsc watch
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 10
- TypeScript Version:  2.0.3 

I'm not sure whether or not to post this in Typescript repo or this one. 

I am getting quite bad typing lag when I've got my tsc transpile task running. The extent of the lag is if I type "hello world" it takes me about 2secs to finish the keystrokes but only fully on the screen after 7-8 seconds. 

I've tried the same with Atom and the atom-typescript plugin which does not have the same issue, I'm not sure what they're using under the hood to do the watch and transpile. I am very happy to debug and provide further diagnostics but not sure what the best way forward is.

I also use the vim extension, but have got the same result with all extensions removed. The typing lag only happens if I initiate the Task > tsc.

Project size: around 200 files (.ts + .js)

tasks.json:

``` json
{
  // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
  // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "command": "tsc",
  "isShellCommand": true,
  "args": ["--watch", "--project", "./app"],
  "showOutput": "silent",
  "isWatching": true,
  "problemMatcher": "$tsc-watch"
}

```

tsconfig.json:

``` json
{
  "version": "2.0.0",
  "compileOnSave": true,
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "es6",
    "module": "commonjs",
    "isolatedModules": false,
    "jsx": "react",
    "experimentalDecorators": true,
    "emitDecoratorMetadata": true,
    "declaration": false,
    "noImplicitAny": false,
    "removeComments": true,
    "noLib": false,
    "preserveConstEnums": true,
    "suppressImplicitAnyIndexErrors": true,
    "watch": true
  },
  "include": [
    "./**/*.ts",
    "./**/*.tsx"
  ],
  "exclude": [
    "!./node_modules/**/*",
    "!./.sass-cache/**/*",
    "!./.vscode/**/*",
    "!./logs/**/*",
    "!./public/dist/**/*",
    "!./public/lib/**/*"
  ]
}
```

data.title: engines.vscode does not accept ranges
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In your extension, set `engines.vscode` to something like `>=1.6`
2. Run the extension
3. An error is shown with the message `Could not parse `engines.vscode` value >=1.6. Please use, for example: ^0.10.0, ^1.2.3, etc.`

So currently, because my extension uses the new `onWillSaveTextDocument` API, it should only be installable from versions higher then `1.6.x`. This is possible with `^1.6.0` as the carret indicates minor updates as well. BUT, what if VS Code (some day) hits `2.0.0`. Does this mean all breaking changes and thus no extension will work anymore. OR, some breaking changes and most of the extensions still work. This would mean that if `vscode.engines` is set to `^1.6.0`, it will not be available in `vscode@2.0.0` and above.

FYI @joaomoreno

data.title: PR
rename label `uiTheme` for future workbench theme
data.body:
In current version, we can only modify `editor(syntax)` theme.
But related #3112, it more fancy to customize the whole workbench.
Now we use `uiTheme` labeled `editor(syntax)` theme.

So, I suggest use **`editorTheme`** or **`syntaxTheme`** for current **`uiTheme`**.
And left **`uiTheme`** for workbench.

data.title: No Intellisense for node packages
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Build 14393

I followed the [instructions for installing typings](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/javascript) for Node modules, as well as the [Node.js specific instructions](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/runtimes/nodejs), but I can't get any Intellisense completions for node modules with installed typings definitions.

**jsonfig.json**

```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "target": "ES6",
        "module": "commonjs"
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules"
    ],
    "files": [
        "src/"
    ]
}
```

I ran the following commands:

```
npm install --save lodash
npm install --global typings
typings install dt~lodash --global --save
```

This gives the following folder structure under `typings`:
![typings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1669397/19297568/ece842f0-900b-11e6-9d4c-06d01c26db06.png)

However, in `src/index.js`, no completions are included for Lodash:
![no suggestions](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1669397/19297580/feba762e-900b-11e6-89b2-001a29a2d07c.png)

Am I missing something obvious here?

data.title: Unable to View or Install Extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  - v1.6.0 stable
  - v.1.7.0 insider
- OS Version:
  - Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Visual Studio Code
2. Click Extensions tab on left-hand side or press ctrl+shift+x

An error appears across the top

``` sh
# exact error from vscode 1.7.0 insider
connect ENOENT /tmp/tylor/Code - Insiders-dbef50-1.7.0-insider-shared.sock
```

virtually the same exact error, only different file name, occurs in v1.6.0 stable.

After doing a tiny bit of investigating, it seems this file is being created at `/tmp` and _not_ `/tmp/tylor` (where tylor is my username), which is not consistent with versions previous to v1.6.0, where there seem to be many `.sock` files located in my `/tmp/tylor` folder.

``` sh
ls -la /tmp | grep Code
drwx------  2 tylor tylor  4096 Oct 10 14:41 VSCode Crashes
srwxrwxr-x  1 tylor tylor     0 Oct 12 00:02 Code - Insiders-dbef50-1.6.0-insider-shared.sock
srwxrwxr-x  1 tylor tylor     0 Oct 12 00:03 Code - Insiders-dbef50-1.7.0-insider-shared.sock
srwxrwxr-x  1 tylor tylor     0 Oct 12 00:03 Code - Insiders-dbef50-1.7.0-insider.sock
srwxrwxr-x  1 tylor tylor     0 Oct 11 23:43 Code-dbef50-1.5.3-shared.sock
srwxrwxr-x  1 tylor tylor     0 Oct 12 00:12 Code-dbef50-1.6.0-shared.sock
srwxrwxr-x  1 tylor tylor     0 Oct 12 00:12 Code-dbef50-1.6.0.sock


ls -la /tmp/tylor
total 40
drwx------  6 tylor tylor  4096 Oct 12 00:15 .
drwxrwxrwt 18 root  root  20480 Oct 12 00:12 ..
drwxrwxr-x  3 tylor tylor  4096 Oct 11 23:29 npm-12071-4dc52ad8
drwxrwxr-x  3 tylor tylor  4096 Oct 11 23:41 npm-13633-0035ceb9
drwxrwxr-x  3 tylor tylor  4096 Oct 11 22:23 npm-6428-edb6f29f
drwxrwxr-x  3 tylor tylor  4096 Oct 11 22:39 npm-7499-fd441190
srwxrwxr-x  1 tylor tylor     0 Oct 12 00:02 vscode-0034836885a5d6c647a5f096cf39f0fca56fa745.sock
srwxrwxr-x  1 tylor tylor     0 Oct 11 23:55 vscode-06b467bc5f4aa27ca69e588b3a24d0bbf486ff85.sock
```

data.title: VS Code Setup Error - uc.micro folder creation access is denied by Antivirus
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: Windows Server 2012
- Antivirus: McAfee

Antivirus treat the uc.micro folder creation as Ransomware virus and cause the setup failure.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download VS Code installer
2. Setup by accepting all default configuration
3. We will get setup error in uc.micro folder creation access is denied, exact error below:-

```
---------------------------
Error
---------------------------
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\markdown\node_modules\uc.micro\CHANGELOG.md



An error occurred while trying to create a file in the destination directory:

Setup was unable to create the directory "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\markdown\node_modules\uc.micro".



Error 5: Access is denied.



Click Retry to try again, Ignore to skip this file (not recommended), or Abort to cancel installation.
---------------------------
Abort   Retry   Ignore   
---------------------------

```

data.title: File body scrolls until last line reaches the top
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.0 (e52fb0bc87e6f5c8f144e172639891d8d8c9aa55, 2016-10-10T18:28:55.412Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.3, HookyQR.minify-0.2.4, HvyIndustries.crane-0.2.1, Kasik96.format-indent-1.3.0, SirTori.indenticator-0.2.1, TwentyChung.jsx-0.0.1, Zignd.html-css-class-completion-1.0.3, bcmarinacci.theme-material-1.3.0, emmanuelbeziat.vscode-great-icons-1.1.11, flowtype.flow-for-vscode-0.3.2, hnw.vscode-auto-open-markdown-preview-0.0.3, robinbentley.sass-indented-1.1.0, wmaurer.html2jade-0.2.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any source-code file, such as: *.php or *.js;
2. Scroll down until it stops scrolling;

Whenever you scroll down a source-code file, it will just stop scrolling when the last line of code (or text) reaches the very top of the text-editor window. It's also possible to scroll down the file, even if file content is smaller than window height!

If file content is longer than window height, at end it makes user see a big empty space in the editor between the last code line and the bottom of editor window, as if we just had only one line of code.
